name: Hooray Henrys Boutique B&B Sheringham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hooray Henry's for the 1940's weekend that was held in Sheringham and Holt. Both Jan and Richard were very friendly and did their upmost to make us feel welcome. The breakfast was outstanding and I couldn't get enough of the flapjacks that they had left in our room.
reviews.title: Sheringham 1940's weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and spaceous, and the bed was very plumfy. The B&B itself was just a 5 minute walk away from Sheringham town centre, which was ideal, as on the Saturday night the town centre was a buzz of activity with music playing through speakers situated around the centre, so it was nice to be able to go back to our room when we'd had enough without any noise.
reviews.title: Comfortable bed and great breakfasts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend Hooray Henry's to anyone thinking of staying in Sheringham.
reviews.title: For a short break check out this B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hosts at Hooray Henrys B and B were very welcoming and friendly. The bed was extremely comfortable and the whole place was very clean. There was plenty of choice for breakfast, which was well cooked and efficiently served. The B and B was within easy walking distance of Sheringham with its shops and pubs, although unfortunately the nearest pub was a big disappointment and not to be recommended. On the downside, the shower cubicle was rather small, the car parking space was challenging and there was limited choice of teas and coffees in the room.
reviews.title: Stay at Hooray Henrys
What a great B&B
reviews.text: We spent a very comfortable three nights here. Our hosts Jan and Richard made us feel very welcome and exemplify the advantages of small B&B's over anonymous hotels. Our room was spotless, the bed was extremely comfortable and the breakfasts were delicious with plenty of choice. The location is a short walk from the sea and the centre of Sheringham. We were able to park in the driveway, which was really convenient. It is incredibly difficult to find any fault at all, but if pushed, I would have liked to have had a thermostat fitted to our shower which ran a bit hot and cold. This was only a very minor issue in our thoroughly enjoyable stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for five nights ( 8th - 13th Sept') The house is situated approximately 10 minutes from the town centre and the beach. we were greeted on our arrival by Jan & Richard and what a nice couple they are, very friendly without being intrusive. Our room was clean, comfortable and well equipped, (home made flap jacks and complimentary newspaper on a daily basis). Car parking is available at the front of the house is also extremely handy. We had a delightful time and intend to return at some future time.
reviews.title: If you are visiting Sheringham area, stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: our grateful thanks to Jan & Richards.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary. A lovely B&B where the little extra touches made all the difference....Thoroughly recommended as a base from which to explore North Norfolk.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very lucky to find this B and B. We only stayed one night but it was very special. We stayed in the Holkham room. It was lovely and gave us ideas about returning with our grandchildren.
reviews.title: An amazing find!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everywhere was so clean. Breakfast was excellent. Extra treats of homemade cookies and sweets was a nice touch. Will definitely return at some point. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Seaside gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried to book this for a weekend stay due to the good reviews on here. The room was showing as available on the owners website so we immediately booked this via Late Rooms (we use them a lot as they provide best value and allow payment in full on arrival). Having received the Late Room confirmation we thought that all was well. Unfortunately we received an email the next day from the owners saying that the room wasn't available. When we questioned this and said that it was showing as available on the Hooray Henry's own website, they came back and said that it had been booked for weeks.
reviews.title: Not able to book via 'Late Rooms' - disapointing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was definitely showing as available when we booked it, so there's obviously a communication issue somewhere. We've used Late Rooms for years and never had a problem, so overall we're disappointed to say the least. Mistakes happen, but it should be simple enough to ensure that the system is updated correctly!
reviews.title: First Class!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jan and Richard are so friendly nothing is too much trouble. We stayed in the Holkam Room which was lovely, spacious, clean with beautifully soft fluffy towels and a fabulously comfortable bed! Home made treats in the room were delicious!
reviews.title: VERY COMFORTABLE BED

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is delicious and served in a light airy room, an absolute pleasure to get up to every morning!
reviews.title: the worlds most comfortable bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly situated for exploring the beautiful coastline and just a short walk into Sheringham.
reviews.title: A wonderful B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can only reiterate what other reviewers have said. The one downside was that we only stayed one night. We were at the start of a motoring tour of East Anglia and Hooray Henry's was the only place we considered going back to. Amazing place; lovely people.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking for a short break in North Norfolk I booked Hooray Henrys because it looked different to the other B&Bs on offer. So very glad we did as the superb standard of this B&B made out holiday. From start to finish Jan and Richard made us welcome...the flapjacks and jellybabies in the room were a nice touch. We were staying in the Blakeney Suite. Not normally a lover of shabby chic I was totally won over by the décor of the room, and I understand the others are of the same high standard. The breakfast room was fresh, clean and decorated in a fun style, and of course the breakfasts were overwhelmingly scrumptious! From toast and jam/marmalade to the full English breakfast, via scrambled egg with smoked salmon, or haddock and poached egg, all the way to the kippers!
reviews.title: Superb B&B
The standard by which all B&Bs should follow! Superb!
reviews.text: Would we stay there again? If we were to return to Sheringham I cannot think of anywhere else I would want to stay it was that good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! If Carlsberg did B&Bs... springs to mind! A hugely warm welcome from Jan who is a fantastic host and also the paintbrush behind the funky decor, a fabulously comfortable room with memory foam mattresses and pillows, homemade delicious flapjacks and sweeties in little jars, brand new linen and towels and beautiful, positive and motivational wording around the place. This really should the standard for all B&Bs the country wide - and we've stayed in a few. Well done guys, highly recommended and we can't wait to stay again. Stay as fabulous as you are!
reviews.title: Must be best in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just arrived back from a lovely stay at Hooray Henrys and have had a great time. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome. With an endless supply of tea coffee and milk as well as Flapjacks and Jellybabies with wanted for nothing. The breakfast were amazing (the Norfolk Breakfast is not for the faint hearted!!!!!) with everything you could wish for and more. We had the Holkam Suite which had a second bed room with bunk beds ideal for a family. It was lovely. The train ride to Holt is a must and the Coast Hopper bus is a great way to travel from place to place. The onsite parking is a bonus as could prove expensive elsewhere.
reviews.title: A lovely stay with delicious breakfast

aka: Hooray Henrys Boutique B&B Sheringham Norfolk
description: Hooray Henrys Boutique B&B has four individually styled en-suite bedrooms offering king or double beds with memory foam mattresses and pillows, flat screen TV with inbuilt DVD player, white linens with hypoallergenic duvets, bathrobes, Tea and coffee facilities with homemade cookies and of course a delicious Norfolk breakfast. (Vegetarian and gluten free diets catered for by request)
